A '''collective operation''' is a concept in [[parallel computing]] in which data is simultaneously sent to or received from many nodes.
Common examples of collective operations are gather (in which data is collected from all nodes), scatter (in which a set of data is broken up into pieces, and a different piece is sent to all nodes), and broadcast (in which the same data is sent to all nodes).
==Parallel computing frameworks with collective operations== Collective operations are present in the following parallel programming frameworks:
* Google's [[MapReduce]] framework * [[Message Passing Interface|MPI]]<ref>[http://www.mcs.anl.gov/research/projects/mpi/mpi-standard/mpi-report-2.0/node144.htm Intercommunicator Collective Operations]. The Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard, chapter 7.3.1. Mathematics and Computer Science Division, [[Argonne National Laboratory]].</ref>
